ygData.subject: Re: Re:What to buy?
ygData.msgSnippet: I am usually at around 12 or 13 weight, depending on how much plat I choose to carry on me.  Personally, I think that large bags are not the way to go. If you
ygData.messageBody:
I am usually at around 12 or 13 weight, depending on how much plat I choose
to carry on me. Personally, I think that large bags are not the way to go.
If you are really careful, you should buy two spits (6 slots, weight 0.2).
I carry two spits and a sewing kit (8 slot, wt 0.4)...total bag weight is
0.8 which is still less than one large bag. I generally never loot because
I am usually always grouped with members of my guild who do a master loot.
The only problem with spits and sewing kits is the evil combine buttion. If
you can find enough will power to stay away from it there shouldn't be a
problem. I have destroyed stuff in the past, but it is usually just
muffins, milk, bandages, or shurikens.

Chingon Cabron <Art of War>
Monk of the 35th Chamber
Brell Serilis


----- Original Message -----
From: "Worlord" <worlord@...>
To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, February 08, 2000 1:00 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Re:What to buy?


> From: Worlord <worlord@...>
>
>
> > It is somewhat high; however, with it on, my total weight is still
> > under 9
> > stones and that includes food, drink, and several stacks of bandages.
> > It not
> > much of a burden and it is greater by 2 AC over cured silk. I am also
> > sometimes
> > guilty of duel weilding combine warhammers (7.3 WT). Typically I group
> > with a
> > warrior and a ranger along with casters, so I rarely take hits and can
> > afford
> > the over 20 weight. I hope to replace them soon with Black Enamelled
> > Maces
> > which will shed about six stones of weight. Nothing else on my person
> > weighs
> > much more than 0.1 with the exception of a Bracer of Erolissi (1.0 WT)
> > and a
> > Serpentine Bracer (0.8 WT). Rusty Spike Shoulderpads, incidentally,
> > are also
> > 2.5 WT and provide 3AC with +5 STR.
> >
> > In Quellious's Name,
> >
> > Manjushri Bodhisattva
> > Bearer of the Red Sash of the Ashen Order
> > (Fennin Ro)
> > ----------------------------------------------------------------------
> > [ONElist Sponsor]
> > Please click above to support our sponsor
> > ----------------------------------------------------------------------
>
> Under 9? thats impressive... what backpacks/boxes do you use... if any?
>
> I generally am at 14 or so... of course I carry an Sewn Evil Eye Pack
> (3wt) and a few Large bags which are 1 wt each
>
> I know its very un-monk of me but I have never abided by the 14 stone
> rule. By this I mean that many monks will never loot past 14 stones but
> I think thats stupid and you will never make money. Sure your losing AC
> and can potentially die faster but its a risk you take to actually make
> some money in the game. I am currently fighting in High Keep which
> rules because its a short job upstairs to the bank =)
>
> Anyone, personally I would never take 2ac for and additional 2.4 wt...
> one thing that is important for monks is ac/wt ration, not ac in itself
>
> Cured Silk Shoulders: 3ac 0.1wt 30ac/wt
> Lizardscale Mantle: 5ac 2.5wt 2ac/wt
>
> In that respect it is much more favorable to take the shoulders
>
> Its all a matter of preference though
>
> --
>
> Hammeron
> Monk of Quellious
> Karana
>
> --
> Worlord
> worlord@...
